column4: Trying to mount a LaCie BigDisk 500GB external HDD (Linux claims it's HPFS/NTFS, I know it's NTFS). sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/sda1 /mnt/sda1 returns an error (wrong fstype, bad option or damaged superblock). Any ideas?
IIRC, you should be using ntfs-3g, instead, anyway.
went down the path of trying to get that a year ago or something... iirc, thats why I gave up. will try again then. :P
Yeah, hence the #ubuntu channel. :P Thanks, will try that.
So yeah, that showed me libntfs-3g-dev, 3g0 and ntfs-3g. What do I do with that info? ^^
Those are packages that provide ntfs-3g
apt-get install ntfs-3g will install it.
Treat me like the rookie I am. Not new to computers at all, but Linux.. That's another story. :P
use "dpkg -L ntfs-3g|grep man" to find the names of the man pages provided.
You should see lines for ntfs-3g.8.gz, mount.ntfs-3g.8.gz, and mount.ntfs.8.gz
Read those manpages.  That should get you a little close.
On it, didnt see nonhighlited at first. :) Thanks for the help. ^^
